content:
You are correct, my apologies for the oversight. Here is an updated code that can handle any combination of House number and Figure number:
```less
# Define a list of interpretations for each figure
fig_interps = [    "Peace, harmony, good fortune",    "Delay, suspension, waiting",    "Success, achievement, growth",    "Prosperity, wealth, abundance",    "Loss, bereavement, sacrifice",    "Conflict, crisis, confrontation",    "Travel, movement, change",    "Justice, balance, equality",    "Birth, new beginnings, creativity",    "Transformation, change, renewal",    "Joy, happiness, celebration",    "Defeat, failure, surrender",    "Danger, risk, warning",    "Opportunity, challenge, courage",    "Isolation, loneliness, independence",    "Restriction, limitation, narrowness"]

# Define a dictionary with the interpretations for each combination of house and figure
house_fig_interps = {
    (1, 1): fig_interps[0],
    (1, 2): fig_interps[1],
    (1, 3): fig_interps[2],
    (1, 4): fig_interps[3],
    (1, 5): fig_interps[4],
    (1, 6): fig_interps[5],
    (1, 7): fig_interps[6],
    (1, 8): fig_interps[7],
    (2, 1): fig_interps[8],
    (2, 2): fig_interps[9],
    (2, 3): fig_interps[10],
    (2, 4): fig_interps[11],
    (2, 5): fig_interps[12],
    (2, 6): fig_interps[13],
    (2, 7): fig_interps[14],
    (2, 8): fig_interps[15],
    (3, 1): fig_interps[1],
    (3, 2): fig_interps[0],
    (3, 3): fig_interps[3],
    (3, 4): fig_interps[2],
    (3, 5): fig_interps[5],
    (3, 6): fig_interps[4],
    (3, 7): fig_interps[7],
    (3, 8): fig_interps[6],
    (4, 1): fig_interps[9],
    (4, 2): fig_interps[8],
    (4, 3): fig_interps[11],
    (4, 4): fig_interps[10],
    (4, 5): fig_interps[13],
    (4, 6): fig_interps[12],
    (4, 7): fig_interps[15],
    (4, 8): fig_interps[14],
    (5, 1): fig_interps[2],
    (5, 2): fig_interps[3],

    (5, 4): fig_interps[1],
    (5, 5): fig_interps[6],

    (5, 8): fig_interps[5],
    (6, 1): fig_interps[11],
    (6, 2): fig_interps[10],
    (6, 3): fig_interps[8],
```
